column4: ok ive googled relentlessly for the past couple minutes trying to figure out how to unmount this iso file i mounted with the following command, sudo mount -o loop /home/julio/Desktop/CRANK.iso /home/julio/Desktop/ , can someone help me unmount it
ive man'ed losetup and umount to no avail
send me the output to pastebin
for some reason it isnt showing anymore, but the folders are still on my desktop

in the future, it's a good idea to create a new directory to mount anything to, you might want to reboot just to be sure things are how they should, anytime you want to unmount something use: umount an the loc you mounted to
does your desktop automatically refresh when u delete a folder on it via command line
thats why I suggested you reboot
you should never mount something thats actually being used like that
yeah i wasnt thinking i would see the iso file mounted as a disk drive on my desktop
lol, I understand, next time do: mkdir /home/julio/Desktop/CDImage or something similiar
